item.title: How the Italian anthem 'Bella Ciao' is connected to Charlie Kirk's killing
item.description: From its association with workers' rights in the 19th century to its inclusion in a video game, the famous old Italian song "Bella Ciao" has an evolving legacy.

item.title: Water failure at Guantánamo Bay affects U.S. migrant operations there
item.description: Migrants sent by the U.S. to Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, were moved to another part of the naval base there because of a water failure, raising doubts about housing large numbers of deportees.

item.title: Utah governor, known for 'disagreeing better,' calls for calm after Kirk shooting
item.description: Utah Gov. Spencer Cox, a Republican, encouraged young people to "choose a different path" from rage and violence. The mantra of "disagreeing better" has morphed into Cox's brand as a politician.

item.title: Missouri passes Trump-backed redistricting plan to help the GOP in the midterms
item.description: Opponents say the plan dilutes the power of Black voters around Kansas City and vow to block it in court or with a referendum. The governor, who's expected to sign the plan, says it reflects the state's conservative values.

item.title: In 2022, the name 'monkeypox' was nixed. Now the U.S. is reviving it
item.description: The World Health Organization retired the name "monkeypox" in favor of mpox — since the virus is spread by rodents and small mammals and there's a stigma factor. Why has the U.S. revived "monkeypox"?
